query.original: Wearing socks with sandals on Mars: fashion crimes?

results.title: Is it criminal to wear socks with sandals? - Quora
results.description: Answer (1 of 10): It's pretty widely considered silly looking more than sloppy. It's like wearing nothing but socks to bed….not sexy. The reason is that either it’s warm enough for sandals, or it’s cool enough for socks and shoes. It’s not usually both at the same time.

The Ancient Egyp­tians Wore Fash­ion­able Striped Socks, New Pio­neer­ing Imag­ing Tech­nol­o­gy Imag­ing Reveals · How Women Got Dressed in the 14th & 18th Cen­turies: Watch the Very Painstak­ing Process Get Cin­e­mat­i­cal­ly Recre­at­ed · Get­ting Dressed Dur­ing World War I: A Fas­ci­nat­ing Look at How Sol­diers, Nurs­ers & Oth­ers Dressed Dur­ing the Great War · Based in Seoul, Col­in Mar­shall writes and broad­casts on cities, lan­guage, and cul­ture.

Of all sar­to­r­i­al crimes, none require quite so much brazen­ness — or sim­ple obliv­i­ous­ness — as the wear­ing of socks with san­dals. But unlike most wide­ly dis­dained fash­ions, which usu­al­ly tend to have enjoyed their hey­day two or three decades ago, the socks-and-san­dals com­bi­na­tion has deep his­tor­i­cal roots.

But for now, we need only make one impor­tant revi­sion to the his­tor­i­cal record: “Britons may be famous for their lack of fash­ion sense and Ital­ians for their style,” as the sub-head­line of Alleyne’s piece puts it, “but it appears we may have inher­it­ed one of our biggest sar­to­r­i­al crimes from the Romans.” ... results.title: Why Are We Wearing Sandals With Socks?
results.description: The first sign of said look going mainstream came in 2005, when J-lizzle, a random user, defined socks and sandals in the Urban Dictionary as “the gangster way for wearing sandels (sic).” He adds, “The only time you will catch a gangster wearing sandels is if it’s summer time and they ...

meta_url.path: › home  › recent  › why are we wearing sandals with socks?

extra_snippets: By today’s standard for what’s “cool” in men’s fashion, my uncle Sam (real name: Shamseddin Hosseini) is Karl Lagerfeld. Why? Because he was wearing sandals with socks back when most men were still toying with the idea of wearing flip-flops in public.

Still, none of this explains why socks and sandals have emerged as the footwear equivalent of fidget spinners for sneakerheads, with fashion houses like Prada and Versace unveiling their own takes on the look.

The first sign of said look going mainstream came in 2005, when J-lizzle, a random user, defined socks and sandals in the Urban Dictionary as “the gangster way for wearing sandels (sic).” He adds, “The only time you will catch a gangster wearing sandels is if it’s summer time and they are wearing some crispy (white) socks with some adidas or jordan or nike sandels. Shit is too GANGSTA. Old people think its gay but anybody who knows fashion knows is G as a mothafucka.”

Still, it wasn’t until September 2015, when The Wall Street Journal ran a story on professional athletes who wear sandals with socks to keep their sneakers clean (“I’ll Be Darned, Wearing Socks With Sandals Is Fashionable”) that the trend had officially been usurped from stubborn holdouts in the immigrant community. A year later, Carolina Panthers quarterback Cam Newton wore socks with sandals to a press conference during Super Bowl week.

results.title: Socks With Sandals: Are They Allowed? | No Cold Feet
results.description: Socks with sandals are generally considered one of the great fashion no-nos, Are they ever okay? We investigate this eternal question.
extra_snippets: For many years, this has generally been considered a fashion faux pas. Wearing these two types of footwear in combination was usually seen as a sign that you were out of touch with the world of style and trends or that you had just flat given up on any attempt at style. However, there have been recent signs indicating that wearing socks and sandals together might either be coming into style or, at least, that it is not as frowned upon as it once was.

One reason to not wear socks and sandals is simple and straightforward. It just looks weird. From a fashion perspective, sandals are designed to look good on your bare feet. When you wear socks it throws off the whole aesthetic.

Like most fashion trends, celebrities are usually the first to embrace these new fads. Lately, there have been several famous people photographed wearing this once despised look. In 2014, Adidas realized that many professional athletes like to wear socks with their Adidas sandals.

Fashion often reflects who you are and how you feel. Making a bold sartorial choice shows that you are a confident person who is willing to challenge convention for something you like or think looks good. Wearing socks and sandals is a bold choice.

results.title: The Debate Around Socks and Sandals at the Men’s Fall 2018 Shows | Vogue
results.description: A showgoer wearing socks and sandals at Paris Fashion Week Men’s Fall 2018Photographed by Phil Oh

meta_url.path: › fashion  › is it time to reconsider men in socks and sandals?

extra_snippets: In the realm of men’s fashion, there are some trends that are so cringe-inducing that they become grossly sexy, like shirts unbuttoned to the navel to reveal male cleavage or toothpick-thin mustaches. These so-bad-they’re-good looks are an acquired taste, much like chopped liver or gefilte fish. You might hate them at first, but after some time, you learn to love them. The same can’t necessarily be said of the long detested socks-and-sandals combination.

Paris Fashion Week Men’s Fall 2018: Maison Kitsuné, Lucien Pellat Finet, and KolorPhotos: Courtesy of the designers · Also favoring shoes is Living Editor Ella Riley-Adams, who said, “I think men should avoid sandals completely unless at the beach, and even then, a good sneaker should still do the trick,” but added, “I don’t mind a smart wool sock with a sandal, if it seems to fit a guy’s overall aesthetic.

Maison Kitsuné featured Teva-style sandals and gray socks, as did Kolor—its strappy sandals had fur! The most gag-worthy example unsurprisingly appeared at Vetements. The label showed burgundy slides with white socks so thin they defined each wiggling toe. As for off the runway, one brave showgoer put the look to the test in Paris, wearing pool slides and socks on the street.

(Bieber hit up his church in blue socks and Givenchy sandals, while Beckham wore white athletic socks and snazzy red Adidas pool slides.) Vogue Senior Fashion News Writer Janelle Okwodu had a measured take: “I don’t hate it. It reminds me of my dad and other suburban dads. The trend belongs to them.” Noted—and sweet! Style Editor Edward Barsamian, however, is not a fan. “I know menswear editors will have my head, as it seems that Tevas and nubby socks are the stuff of their dreams, but in practical terms, it’s not such an elegant look,” he said.

results.title: Men are committing crimes against fashion by pairing socks with sandals - the colour mix alone would probably make Gok Wan curl up and die | The Irish Sun
results.description: IF you thought brown sandals with white socks and questionable shorts to go with them were reserved for the Irish man above pensionable age, I’ve some stark news. Over the weekend of amazing …
extra_snippets: There, I witnessed a man who can’t have been more than 40, wearing brown leather strap sandals, complete with white socks and, the best part, floral patterned shorts. The colour mix alone would probably make Gok Wan curl up and die if he happened to stumble across a playground in Fairview over the weekend. This, of course, was just one single crime against fashion by the Irish man.
During the weekend's amazing weather I witnessed a man wearing brown leather strap sandals, complete with white socks and, the best part, floral patterned shorts

IF you thought brown sandals with white socks and questionable shorts to go with them were reserved for the Irish man above pensionable age, I've some stark news. Over the weekend of amazing weather, I, like many other dads, found myself in a busy playground hoping to burn off energy for some small people. ... There, I witnessed a man who can’t have been more than 40, wearing brown leather strap sandals, complete with white socks and, the best part, floral patterned shorts.

We don't care if another toe starts growing out of our foot, we don't care if a simple spray of sun cream is all that would stop us from looking like lobsters and we don't care how we look when it comes to what we were wear in the sun. ... This isn’t the case for all men, of course. A sweeping generalisation like that would be foolish — it's just all the men I saw over the weekend. There's a bunch of Italians upstairs in our office who always dress in the finest suits. ... The Irish lads two floors down look like they all got dressed in the dark. I really, really hope the good weather stays but if you are a fashion buyer for a major clothes store and you're reading this, could you please make it easy for us lads to get it right by maybe tagging shorts and tops that match and burning any form of leather strapped sandals that are currently on a shelf in the land.

results.title: Blend it like Beckham! How the socks and sandals combo became cool | Fashion | The Guardian
results.description: Once seen as a fashion faux pas, the footwear trend is down to comfort, the grunge aesthetic … and star power
extra_snippets: When it comes to trends, history often repeats itself, but you’d be forgiven for thinking that the once ultimate male sartorial gaffe – sandals worn with socks – had long been consigned to the fashion dustbin. But last week the man who has become synonymous with boundary-pushing fashion choices – David Beckham – was photographed on his wife Victoria’s Instagram page wearing black slider sandals with white sport socks.

“There seems to be a trend toward clothing that is ‘sloppy’ and that would certainly include socks with sandals,” says Gregory Locke, a 31-year-old lawyer, who is back to wearing the look after giving it up when he left university. “There’s a significant amount of effort put into dressing in a way that communicates you put in no effort at all – the grungier or sloppier you look the more fashionable you seem to be.”

The sock-sandal journey from fashion no-no to trend has been gradual. “Unless you are a fifth century pharoah, socks with sandals is a terrible look,” wrote Project Runway’s Tim Gunn in his 2012 Fashion Bible. “On both men and women, it comes off as ageing and inappropriate.”

The sock-sandal pairing found its place in the 2010s with two menswear fashion trends which took pleasure in the wilfully ugly. Normcore from 2014, a trend for dressing purposefully suburban and non-fashion, saw the beginnings of the elevation of the humble sandal.

results.title: Why We’re Reconsidering the Socks and Sandals Trend
results.description: Since staying home, the usually questionable socks and sandals look is proving to be the cool and comfortable choice once again.

meta_url.path: › fashion  › sandals  › give the socks and sandals trend a try this summer

extra_snippets: Although it’s normally associated with dorky dads and tourists, the socks and sandals look has gained new appreciation in the past year and since we’ve been at home. If you can’t go outside, you won’t be wearing shoes as much, meaning quality socks are the ideal choice.

Meanwhile, everyone from Justin Bieber to Sophie Turner has taken the humble pool-slide-and-sock look for a spin, and Kendall Jenner donned camping socks with Birkenstocks last summer. Meanwhile, Katie Holmes wore the trend to a formal affair by wearing a heeled sandal with a sheer sock, proving that the combination can be just as cool outdoors as in.

If you can’t go outside, you won’t be wearing shoes as much, meaning quality socks are the ideal choice. And if you happen to sometimes slip on an indoor slide or slipper, that’s great too. I have been experimenting with that pairing as I try to find the balance between luxe indoor style and a solution for covering up my always cold, non-pedicured toes. Meanwhile, everyone from Justin Bieber to Sophie Turner has taken the humble pool-slide-and-sock look for a spin, and Kendall Jenner donned camping socks with Birkenstocks last summer.

Platform Teva-like sandals and socks were paired with breezy lace dresses and bucket hats at Anna Sui, while T-shirt dresses at A.P.C. were styled with wood-based strappy heeled sandals and a pair of colored socks. There were flatforms and finely ribbed socks at Fendi, while sweet, floral, embroidered versions slipped into spiked flat slides at Simone Rocha.

results.title: The Stylish Gent’s Guide To Wearing Socks And Sandals | The Journal | MR PORTER
results.description: Often derided and laughed at as messy or only “for dads”, socks and sandals have become rather stylish and extremely cool. Here’s how to nail the look
extra_snippets: Let’s get this straight from the start: socks and sandals have long been the purview of Grateful Dead fans and high-school physics teachers. This is not an attempt to sweep this embarrassing history under the rug. Even just sandals on men provoke some loud, strong opinions.

Even just sandals on men provoke some loud, strong opinions. (Male toes? The horror!) But, judging from some stylish men seen on streets around the world, perhaps it’s time to rethink this particular footwear conundrum – can socks worn under sandals actually be… good?

Yes, they’re a bit of a contradiction. (Socks are to keep your toes warm and sandals are to let them breathe free, right?) But, as you will see below, socks and sandals really are good – with a few caveats. Please take care that all socks are clean and without holes, that’s the number one rule.
